cyclone.name: BARRY
cyclone.current_location: about 85 miles SSW of the mouth of the Mississippi River
cyclone.trajectory: Slowly drifting west-northwest, then turning northwest Friday night and north Saturday toward the central-southeastern Louisiana coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near Morgan City, Louisiana (central Louisiana coast)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Mouth of the Mississippi River to Grand Isle and Intracoastal City to Cameron
weather_observation.warning_coast: Mouth of the Pearl River to Grand Isle, Lake Pontchartrain & Maurepas, and Intracoastal City to Cameron
weather_observation.impacted_coast: North-central Gulf Coast from Upper Texas through Louisiana to the Alabama coast
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (39–57 mph) possible with a 39% cumulative probability, peaking Saturday as the center approaches inland.
weather_observation.storm_surge: 3–5 ft inundation possible along the southwest Louisiana coast (Intracoastal City–Cameron) with water funneling into Calcasieu Ship Channel toward Lake Charles.
weather_observation.rainfall: 4–8 inches with locally higher totals possible, producing flash-flood risk and operational disruptions.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes Friday–Saturday; reduced visibilities and strong currents affecting navigation.
